ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] It's been swell folks
ygData.msgSnippet: wow, is this the info getting sent back to verant? why haven t i seen this anywhere in the huge discussions on gameplay forum? (granted i haven t dug enough
ygData.messageBody:
wow, is this the info getting sent back to verant?
why haven't i seen this anywhere in the huge discussions on gameplay forum?
(granted i haven't dug enough maybe)

is it ok if one of us posts is there?

-----Original Message-----
From: Dennis Gustavsson [mailto:dennis@...]
Sent: Wednesday, April 05, 2000 11:46 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] It's been swell folks



I doubt anyone have c: in their everquest catalog


"

Eqgame Attributes C:\WINDOWS\TEMPORARY INTERNET FILES SUCCESS GetAttributes

GetAttributes *3 lines

4096 *2 lines

Eqgame Read C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM\TAPI32.DLL SUCCESS Offset: 106496 Length:
4096 - 2 lines

then randomly later on I keep seeing 3 lines of this here and there:

Eqgame Seek C:\WINDOWS\TEMPORARY INTERNET FILES\CONTENT.IE5\INDEX.DAT
SUCCESS Beginning Offset: 0 / New offset: 0

"

"Kevin L. Crawford" wrote:

> Agreed.
>
> They've gone too far this time.
>
> I sent a email complaining to bmcquaid@... (Brad),
jbutler@...
> (Jeff Butler) and jsmedley@... (john smedley). I suggest that
anyone
> who feels strongly that this will compromise EverQuest send these three a
> courteous email regarding the matter.
>
> Don't flame, be polite and be concise. Hopefully we can get them to see
> reason. I personally will not be playing again until/unless that part of
> the eula is removed.
>
> It's been wonderful.... farewell my friends...
>
> Kev
>
> aka: Lyrnia Jongleur, Bard of Norrath (Retired)
>
> >
> > Well, since Mr. Smedley and company have decided that to protect their
own
> > backside (see....lies we got away with till some smart users outfoxed
us)
> > and are putting this in their EULA....
> >
> > "You hereby grant us permission to download Game-related files to you.
You
> > also grant us permission to access, extract and upload
> > (i) Game-related data as part of the patching process and (ii) data
> > relating to any program that we, in our reasonable discretion, determine
> > interferes with the proper operation of EverQuest
> >
> > I will no longer be financially supporting EQ in any way, shape or form.
> >
> > I know what caused it - I know I have neither the technical expertise,
or
> > equipment setup to do it - but I'll be DAMMED if I am going to give some
> > gaming company - companies that are notorious for hiring 'you want fries
> > with that help' permission to sniffel around the innards of my PC.
> >
> > In case the above doesn't make a lot of sense to you - in plain English
it
> > means....
> >
> > You give us permission to look at anything WE think we need to inside
your
> > PC - and upload it to our offices.
> >
> > I don't know bout the rest of you, but I have a heck of a lot of
personal
> > information, CC #s, Tax information, etc on the same machine I use for
> > 'gaming' - and I'll be dammed if I give them a blank check to poke
around
> > as they see fit - and ship things of interest back to their offices.
Sorry
> > - trust only goes so far.
> >
> > http://lum.xrgaming.net/ for a rant and message board on this subject.
> >
> >
> >
> >
